page.title: 10Trade and Economics
page.content:
Mobile shops serve the area weekly (baker and butcher) or fortnightly (grocer). The nearest local store is at Caldbeck. For a wider choice people must go to Wigton, Penrith or Carlisle. Milk is delivered. Daily newspapers may be received by post or are delivered by the driver of the daily milk tanker. Sunday papers must be collected from Caldbeck. Most house holds take a local weekly paper. Petrol is available in Caldbeck.
State pensions and benefits are drawn at Caldbeck Post Office. Few people are now paid in cash. Earnings are paid into the bank monthly or weekly and bills are settled by cheque or credit card. Monthly accounts with local stores, mobile shops or for petrol are paid when the monthly milk-cheque or salary is received.
